result.execSummary:
The defendant Keri L. Rowan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fraudulent Use of a Credit Card [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.41(5)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
**2 days credit, if revoked** 
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: 21CF972

records.addlTxt:
(Cases 21CF972, 22CF230 are called at 2:00 PM- by Zoom) Defendant Keri L. Rowan appeared by video.  Attorney Kerry A. Kelm appeared by video for Keri L. Rowan separately.  Attorney Kelly Ronquist appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Victim/Witness statute complied with. Defense indicates there is an agreement and recites the joint sentence recommendation. Defendant waives right to personal appearance. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Defendant pleads No Contest to 21CF972 Count 2- Possession of Drug Paraphernalia as Repeater and 22CF230 Count 2- Fraudulent use of a Credit Card as Repeater. Court accepts plea and finds the Defendant guilty. Remaining charges are dismissed and read in. 
Court withholds sentence and orders 12 months Probation with the following conditions: AODA and follow through with recommendations; No contact with victim C.C.; Restitution to be determined within 60 days; Maintain absolute sobriety; Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations; Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge; Court costs. Court orders 2 days credit, if revoked on each case.
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights (with Attachment)
Status conference on April 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

10:07 AM Cases called: 21CF972 & 22CF230 Defendant Keri L. Rowan appeared in court, in custody, Attorney Kerry A. Kelm appeared in court for Keri L. Rowan, Attorney Kelly Ronquist appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. 
22CF230: Waived reading of the criminal complaint. Time limits for preliminary hearing waived. 
Both cases scheduled for a STC: 04/27/22 at 2pm in Br. 1
